sections.name: 1.  Instructions
sections.instructions:
Purpose: Intent of this Software data sheet is to aid potential acquirers obtain critical information directly from vendors as the acquirers make their purchasing decisions.

Instructions: Complete Sections 2 through 4 as described below. Each Section has a comments section for any additional information vendor deems pertinent.

Section 2. General Information - System Description - Provide basic naming, versioning and description information. Also requests existing requirements (government or other) that the component was built to.

Section 3 - Software Delivery Information - Provide general system information associated with the software

Section 4 - Attributes - Each of the primary attributes (Performance, Security/Vulnerability, Usability, Software Design, Supportability, Testability, Scalability, Extensibility, Interoperability, and Affordability) has multiple sub-attributes. Requested responses range from simple "Yes, No, N/A" to detailed descriptions/provision of documentation
To go to a spcific section of the Acquisition Workflow, click on the drop-down box and select the area you wish to edit.

NOTE: Each question also has an option to indicate if the information is public or private. By default, each question is marked "Public." Public means the information will be published on the DI2E Storefront.

sections.name: 2. Software Description
sections.instructions: Complete the below form with general company and product information:

fields.label: Company Name
Point Of Contact
Product/System Name
Short Product Description
Which Joint Common System Function(s) from the JOINT COMMON SYSTEM FUNCTION LIST (JCSFL) DICTIONARY does the software implement?
From your required capability document, identify what specific capability this component implements?  Provide your referenced capability document and specific required capability(s).
Does a CONOPS exist for a proposed solution or an existing, similar use case?
Does a Software Requirements Specification (SRS) / Software Requirements Description (SRD) or other similar documentation exist?

fields.staticContent: Step 1: Download form and complete information per the instructions on the template. Download

fields.label: Upload completed form
List the machines and/or services you require and machine resources.
List hardware attributes that would have a negative impact on the operation of your software, or identify hardware attributes that would have a optimize the operation of your software.
What operating system(s) does the software require?
Is in memory storage required to maintain required performance identified above (e.g. in memory database)?
Specify the minimum/ maximum throughput on inputs and outputs.  In addition, What data sources was performance testing performed on? (data sources have their own performance requirements)
Is in memory storage required to maintain required performance identified above (e.g. in memory database)?
fields.commentLabel: Yes, identify who monitors the performance:

fields.label: If performance is guaranteed by the Service Level Agreement, are there contractual enforcement clauses?
Has performance verification been performed on the component?
Is the component foreign owned, developed by foreigners or developed overseas?
Is the component foreign owned, developed by foreigners or developed overseas?
What is the intended Classification For Use (Select all that apply)?
Is the component foreign owned, developed by foreigners or developed overseas?
fields.commentLabel: If Yes, state what is audited/logged, and the mechanisms for doing so. (E.g., log4j is used to support logging and auditing of logins,  searches, downloads, and other data) If No or N/A, state why in the comments section.

fields.label: Does the software have a user interface?
Describe the frameworks (e.g., Bootstrap) and/or UI libraries that were used to develop the software?
Can the software be demonstrated?
List all commercial programming languages (compiled and interpreted) used (e.g. Java, C++, Scala) and standards are implemented and which version(s).
Is the software DCGS Integration Backbone (DIB) compatible?
Briefly describe the overall system (hardware and software) technical architecture in which this software resides.
Are there DoD-relevant Use Cases for this software?
Has the software been evaluated for supportability?
When are maintenance releases to be made available? (i.e. upgrade schedule)?
Is there a Software Maintenance Agreement and Release Schedule?
Are there automated test tools to verify functionality?
fields.commentLabel:
If Yes, identify tools and describe how often they are used in comments
If No, state why
If N/A, state why

fields.label: Are test plans, procedures and results available?
Has this software passed a DI2E Conformance Test Kit (CTK), or otherwise been assessed in a DI2E event (e.g. ENTERPRISE CHALLENGE)?
fields.commentLabel: If yes, identify which CTKs and/or event

fields.label: How does the software scale to meet the requirements of a denser operating environment (more signals, more users, etc.) or provide more capability?
How does the hardware scale to meet the requirements of a denser operating environment (more signals, more users, etc.) or provide more capability?
Does your software operate in a virtualized environment?
What kinds of changes (e.g.  Ports, protocols, schema) to the software impact the interface?
Do mechanisms exist to support integrating additional functionality?
fields.commentLabel: If Yes, describe the mechanisms. (Example Common mechanisms are install a new virtual machine, install new container (e.g. Docker), install new program, install new plugin shared object or jar, install new script, or install new declarative mapping.)

fields.label: Does the system employ a modular design (MOSA compliant)?
fields.commentLabel: If Yes describe in comments. (Example:  If the system requires all extensions to be jar files running within a single web application then it has limited modularity. Conversely, a system composed of many micro services would be considered highly modular.)

fields.label: Are DISR standards implemented by this software?
fields.commentLabel: If Yes, list the standards below:

fields.commentLabel: If Yes, list standards in comments section below:

fields.label: Are components used within this suite accessible by external systems?
fields.commentLabel: If Yes, list the mechanism below:

fields.label: Does this software require a license?

fields.staticContent: If Yes, please answer/respond to (A-1.1 through A-1.4) If No, skip to A-2

fields.label: Provide a copy of the software license agreement

fields.staticContent: Provide cost model associated with licensing, purchasing, maintaining this code. (Upload document or comment below)

fields.label: Provide cost model associated with licensing, purchasing, maintaining this code.
Provide cost model Comment
dentify the Intellectual Property rights (for both Software Development Kit and OPERATIONAL SW)

With regards to the Government’s rights in non-commercial technical data and software deliverables ( DFARS 252.227-7013 and 252.227-7014) , does the government have Unlimited (U/L) Rights or Government Purpose Rights (GPR) as defined in the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) and the Department of Defense (DoD) Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement (DFARS)?
Is the software is GOTS?
fields.commentLabel: If Yes, define the support costs and identify the intellectual property rights (for SDK and operational software).
